channel.title: Readings for 3K by topic on 3K: Dynamics and Heterogeneity
channel.description: Recent content in Readings for 3K by topic on 3K: Dynamics and Heterogeneity

item.title: Topic 1 Readings
item.description: Day 1 Box-Steffensmeier, Freeman, Hitt, and Pevehouse, Chapter 1. Hsiao, Cheng, Why Panel Data? (September 6, 2005). IEPR Working Paper No. 05.33. Available at SSRN: https://ssrn.com/abstract=820204 or http://dx.doi.org/10.2139/ssrn.820204 or here

item.title: Topic 2 Readings
item.description: Univariate ARIMA Models Box-Steffensmeier, Freeman, Hitt, and Pevehouse, Chapter 2 and 5. Optional but strongly encouraged is their Appendix on Difference Equations. ARIMA Models in R. From Hyndman Falklands Intervention Clarke, et. al.. Harold will discuss this in the last 1.25 hours.

item.title: Topic 3 Readings
item.description: Time Series Regression Models Box-Steffensmeier, Freeman, Hitt, and Pevehouse, Chapter 3 and 4. Williams and Whitten, But Wait... dynsim

item.title: Topic 4 Readings
item.description: Cointegration and Error Correction Box-Steffensmeier, Freeman, Hitt, and Pevehouse, Chapter 6. Cointegration and ECM in R. From Colonescu, Chs. 12 and 13 Harold will discuss: Major’s lesser (not minor) effects: prime ministerial approval and governing party support in Britain since 1979

item.title: Topic 5 Readings
item.description: Heterogeneity in Single Time Series Box-Steffensmeier, Freeman, Hitt, and Pevehouse, Chapter 7. ARCH and GARCH From Colonescu, Chs. 14 Harold will talk about two of his pieces on this. They cover examples of ARCH/GARCH. They are: Tony Blair’s War and Clarke, Whiteley, Borges, Sanders, and Stewart. 2016. Modelling the dynamics of support for a right-wing populist party: the case of UKIP. JEPOP.
